results.title: Painted daughters (1925)
results.brief_description: Painted Daughters is a romantic melodrama about high society and the “flapper” generation. It tells the story of Mary Elliot and Courtland Nixon, dancing partners in the stage show “Floradora”. Mary forsakes Courtland and marries a wealthy admirer, who soon goes bankrupt and suicides, leaving her to raise a little daughter, Maryon. Following in her mother’s footsteps Maryon eventually finds success in a theatrical career. A press agent, Ernest Glenning, decides to gather the original cast of “Floradora” for a charity performance, and Mary again meets Courtland. After the Show they are both injured in an apartment fire and from their hospital beds, by telephone, they arrange their wedding to coincide with that of Maryon and Ernest.

results.title: Pageant of the high country
results.brief_description: North eastern Victoria, a land of rugged mountains and fertile valleys takes on a variety of aspects with changes in weather. As the winter snows melt, cattle are taken to graze on the lush plains of Mount Dargo and Bogong, under the supervision of the Soil Conservation Authority. The Kiewa hydro-electricity plant harnesses the waters of the mountain rivers. In winter it becomes a popular playground for ski enthusiasts.

results.title: Paganini strikes again
results.creator_credit: Gerry O'Hara, Cyril Randell and CFF Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Benjamin Lee. This story tells of Mike and Bill, who on returning from a violin lesson, get stuck in a lift and by chance see a clue to a criminal’s identity - his feet. Should they tell the police? And why is the strange boy in their form so scared?

results.title: Paderewski playing his Minuet followed by Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata
results.brief_description: The famous pianist, Paderewski, plays Beethoven’s Nocturne in C sharp minor, Opus 27 (better known as the “Moonlight Sonata”), and his own composition, Paderewski’s Minuet in G. Contains interesting footage of the audience and the wonderful “art deco” venue.

results.title: Paddington goes to the movies (K)
results.creator_credit: Barry Leith, Graham Clutterbuck, FilmFair Communications and Paddington
results.brief_description: Paddington is caught in a storm and shelters in the entrance of a cinema where he discovers that “Singing in the Rain” starring Gene Kelly is screening. Being an unaccompanied bear under 16, Paddington is not allowed in. However, he manages to peer through a keyhole and catches his first glimpse of the world of the silver screen. Unfortunately, in typical Paddington fashion, he also wreaks havoc in the theatre and the projection box. On his way home, in the excitement of the moment, Paddington tries to emulate the dancing of Gene Kelly. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington goes to the movies
results.creator_credit: Barry Leith, Graham Clutterbuck, FilmFair Communications and Paddington
results.brief_description: Paddington is caught in a storm and shelters in the entrance of a cinema where he discovers that “Singing in the Rain” starring Gene Kelly is screening. Being an unaccompanied bear under 16, Paddington is not allowed in. However, he manages to peer through a keyhole and catches his first glimpse of the world of the silver screen. Unfortunately, in typical Paddington fashion, he also wreaks havoc in the theatre and the projection box. On his way home, in the excitement of the moment, Paddington tries to emulate the dancing of Gene Kelly. Narrated by Michael Hordern and based on the book by Michael Bond. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington cleans up (K)
results.brief_description: Adapted from Chapter 2 from the book “Paddington on Top” by Michael Bond. Charming animated tale about neighbourhood free-loader, Mr Curry, plotting to have Paddington clean his house for free. However his plans come unstuck when Paddington is unable to locate a power point for his vacuum cleaner.
